title: Kai Jie’s website
text:
Introduction



Ng Kai Jie



Applied Artificial Intelligence student at Singapore Institute of Technology. Proficient in analysing data into granular bits for solving real world issues with insights.



I am a passionate learner who is always eager to explore new technologies and methodologies. I have a strong foundation in programming languages and data analysis, and I am excited to apply my skills in real-world projects.


Skills
Coding: Python, Java, C, R, Bash, JavaScript, HTML, CSS

title: Past Projects
text:
Project 1

print("Hello World")

Don’t worry, I did more than Hello World



Project 2

title: Reflection
text:
I have used ChatGPT as my GenAI tool. I chose it because it is the first well-known and widely used tool. It is easy to use, has a user-friendly interface and additionally, I have a Plus membership!
GitHub Copilot was used too as it integrates into RStudio which was the main IDE used to complete this assessment.



I used ChatGPT to debug issues for my project and to help me with the writing process. For example, I forgot how to embed a link and open it in a new tab without replacing the current open tab, and it provided several suggestions.



It’s super quick, I don’t understand how AI has lesser neurons than a brain but it’s somewhat faster. Maybe it is because AI has memory retention as compared to the human brain.



The prompts have to be just right, else it will not give the right answer and just gives you a hallucinated answer or something else entirely.



I think GenAI tools will be very useful in the future for generating ideas, writing code, and definitely debugging. I would like to think I am not a very creative person, and being able to generate ideas on the go is quite a valuable skill.



The time to do this assessment is not enough.

title: Outside of work
text:
Movie Ratings
I love movies, hence I created this page to share my thoughts on some of my favorite movies.

1. Minecraft Movie
Kids movie, not worth watching as an adult. But totally brings back some childhood memories.



2. Harry Potter
I really don’t understand the hype. I mean, it’s a good movie, but not as good as the hype.



3. Captain America: Brave New World

I love the Captain America series. The action, the story, the characters, everything. But this was quite a disappointment.
